column5: I know you have been looking for a place on the water, and how much you want to move back to Barrie, so I seen this today.  Heres your chance..........................  http://www.bernicewhelanrealty.ca/properties/2981-ridge-road-west-shanty-bay-ontario-l0l2l0  Always loved looking at this house from the water. The pics are awesome.  Ok so, all I need is a AK47 . I will walk the grounds. Just give me the boat house. LOL
I joked with my wife that we should make an appointment with our bank and ask them for a mortgage. If we sold our house 30-40 times would could just about swing it.

hahaha...there were so many zeros on the price I am not even sure how much they want. Seems a little small if you ask me Anyways, you are correct, I have been looking. Funny thing is, I actually just bought a place a few weeks ago, closing is still coming up. Your timing is quite coincidental. Unfortunately, its not near Barrie....that was just too far away (not to mention a few zeros out of my budget). It is on a small lake called Habermehl..over near Hanover. I actually asked a question about that lake on here at the time I was looking....and since I got zero public replies (did get one pm) I thought that is a good thing! The less known the better. You are welcome to launch your personal craft there any time. Apparently it has dink pike and stunted largemouth...perfect for my kids!
if it wasn't for the baseboards heating, i'd be all over that..
Nice shack! The property taxes alone are probably beyond me!
Well, I could do the 16 part. The rest of it is beyond my means. I feel like I spent money even just looking at that listing.
if it wasn't for the baseboards heating, i'd be all over that.. But hydro rates are dropping Raf, so it may be affordable after all! HH
if only there was room for my hand maidens maids,I would be all over  this
The baseboard heating really does put it out of reach for the common man!

Very interesting, I always wondered if it was a resort. As it turns out the original owner survived the Titanic. One ceiling picture shows the ship and the centre piece on the dining room table is a model of the ship.  Thanks for sharing this!

Very interesting, I always wondered if it was a resort. As it turns out the original owner survived the Titanic. One ceiling picture shows the ship and the centre piece on the dining room table is a model of the ship.  Thanks for sharing this!  " Solid brick Victorian residence - built in 1867 by the wealthy timber baron, Robert, and said to be fashioned after his family estate in Ireland "  Titanic guy may have been the second owner?
If you got a spare 215K a year for the property taxes you may be able to afford the asking price! The property is severable after all if you need some maintenance money.... lol.
Given the RE market that pad will be what 32 mil in 3 years?  ?
And you know that guy would never stop talking about being on the Titanic at every party.
The baseboard heating really does put it out of reach for the common man!  What do you figure...about $682,000.00 to insulate, install duct work and convert to gas?
Union gas will insulate for free though! ????? Yeah right hahaha
